Added PermissiveSchema to handle the additionalProperties=True case.

I also changed the property jsonschema to a method raw().

Really not cool with module-level globals except in cases where there is a well-established consensus of using global singletons for that particular concern (i.e. config). The side effect risks just make it a silly practice.

This is probably still a little dough-y. From a private conversation with Brian Lamar, I'm looking at restructuring the v2 api differently, using grouping based on endpoints (image, access, tags, data) rather than subfunction (controller, [de]serializer, schema)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-14 19:03:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-13 18:39:24.000000000', 'message': 'Move the particulars of v2 schemas under v2

- Create a new Schema class
- glance.api.v2.schemas contains modules for instantiating Schemas with
  the right attributes and constraints for v2 endpoints
- Schema class should make a good starting point for future additions
  such as handling links and read-write protected properties

[{'created': '2012-06-20 20:25:08.000000000', 'message': 'Admin action to reset states.

Adds support for the new Nova Admin API action which resets the state
of an instance.  This will at least allow easy clean-up from bugs
which corrupt the state of an instance and inhibit the owner of the
instance from deleting it.

Change-Id: I47d1d75e3bd2a07b3b75302b512122b27d5d79d9
'}]
commit_message:
Admin action to reset states.

Adds support for the new Nova Admin API action which resets the state
of an instance.  This will at least allow easy clean-up from bugs
which corrupt the state of an instance and inhibit the owner of the
instance from deleting it.

Change-Id: I47d1d75e3bd2a07b3b75302b512122b27d5d79d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-22 14:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

The recent RPC versioning support introduced some odd behavior if a non-
existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not
exist (as the code used to do, in the form of an AttributeError), it now
Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found, instead
of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Change-Id: Icb7b13fa890000f1bd03382d5cce747e3311ef6a
'}, {'created': '2012-06-22 14:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

The recent RPC versioning support introduced some odd behavior if a non-
existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not
exist (as the code used to do, in the form of an AttributeError), it now
Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found,
instead of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Also add unit tests for the cases:
 - API matches
  - Method Present
  - Method Not Present
 - API does not match
  - Method Present
  = Method Not Present

Change-Id: Icb7b13fa890000f1bd03382d5cce747e3311ef6a
'}, {'created': '2012-06-22 14:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not

Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found, instead
of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Change-Id: Icb7b13fa890000f1bd03382d5cce747e3311ef6a
'}, {'created': '2012-06-22 14:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not

Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found,
instead of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Also add unit tests for the cases:
 - API matches
  - Method Present
  - Method Not Present
 - API does not match
  - Method Present
  - Method Not Present

Change-Id: Icb7b13fa890000f1bd03382d5cce747e3311ef6a
'}, {'created': '2012-06-22 14:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

The recent RPC versioning support introduced some odd behavior if a non-
existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not
exist (as the code used to do, in the form of an AttributeError), it now
Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found,
instead of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Also add unit tests for the cases where a method is missing, both when
the API version matches and not.

Change-Id: Icb7b13fa890000f1bd03382d5cce747e3311ef6a
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

The recent RPC versioning support introduced some odd behavior if a non-
existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not
exist (as the code used to do, in the form of an AttributeError), it now
Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found,
instead of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Also add unit tests for the cases where a method is missing, both when
the API version matches and not.

Change-Id: Icb7b13fa890000f1bd03382d5cce747e3311ef6a

commit_message:
Partially fix bug 1015821

Add aggregates-list to api-site

Patch set 2 fixes wadl so that mvn generate-sources builds
successfully. Just simplified some of the resources.

Also added more definition for "what is an aggregate anyway?"
so please review and edit as needed. I'm pretty sure
an aggregate is defined by the cloud provider, right? 1:wq

Change-Id: I097df5d2051b053508dabcc9d001771a94415dae

commit_message:
Utilize newer changes in openstack-common.

Use common.setup.get_cmdclass() to clean-up redundant code.

* keystone/openstack/common/setup.py
  Sync from openstack-common project.

* setup.py
  Code clean-up. No functional change.

Change-Id: I12f538ba8e727270b3b615dc06b0fd0328f36e1e

This systematically replaces anyplace that deals with dates or
times in Horizon with Django's timezone-aware machinery, and
enables timezone support in settings.

The assumption is that the server time should *always* be UTC.

TO DO: Add a setting for allowing the user to change their preferred
timezone display and add timezone indicators anywhere times are
displayed to the user.

Implements blueprint timezones. Also fixes bug 927974.

Change-Id: I5e462ba86e64b97b46873a017f87f328acee1b1d
"}]
commit_message:
Make Horizon timezone-aware.

This systematically replaces anyplace that deals with dates or
times in Horizon with Django's timezone-aware machinery, and
enables timezone support in settings.

The assumption is that the server time should *always* be UTC.

TO DO: Add a setting for allowing the user to change their preferred
timezone display and add timezone indicators anywhere times are
displayed to the user.

Implements blueprint timezones. Also fixes bug 927974.

Change-Id: I5e462ba86e64b97b46873a017f87f328acee1b1d

commit_message:
Cherry picked from review.openstack.org/#/c/8096 as it pertains to essex as well
Fixes steps 2 and 3 of identity image.

Fixes steps 2 and 3 of identity image. Fixes bug 911892.
Step 2 is a get tenants request and has a response with it. Added the response.
Step 3 assumes a scoped token to a tenant so added a call to get the scoped token.

By Joe Savak <joe.savak@rackspace.com>, from failed review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/2873/

Change-Id: I8fcff0ff0e9f6814b1feeb15936325278e1e5847

Fixes steps 2 and 3 of identity image. Fixes bug 911892.
Step 2 is a get tenants request and has a response with it. Added the response.
Step 3 assumes a scoped token to a tenant so added a call to get the scoped token.

By Joe Savak <joe.savak@rackspace.com>, from failed review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/2873/

Change-Id: I8fcff0ff0e9f6814b1feeb15936325278e1e5847
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes steps 2 and 3 of identity image.

Fixes steps 2 and 3 of identity image. Fixes bug 911892.
Step 2 is a get tenants request and has a response with it. Added the response.
Step 3 assumes a scoped token to a tenant so added a call to get the scoped token.

By Joe Savak <joe.savak@rackspace.com>, from failed review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/2873/

Change-Id: I8fcff0ff0e9f6814b1feeb15936325278e1e5847

commit_message:
Kill all swift processes before trying to install.

- Before trying to install swift we ensure there is no swift processes
  running.

Change-Id: Ibeb511a67f1ccc4914d9cdf2874324159e3928cc

Ok, wow. This is a serious issue. It was fixed on master a month ago. It includes a good amount of tests. Good.

However, it's a very invasive change and the backport needed to be significantly different from the fix that was merged into master. That's an excellent recipe for regressions, and we'll be releasing as soon as it's merged :(

However, given that the backport is by Gabriel, three other horizon-core members have approved it and Devin's the other stable-maint approver ... approving."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Set up Simple DB driver tests

This adds a few bootstrappy test cases to get the db tests running
against the simple db driver. I've also added a decorator for the
simple driver methods to make these tests uber useful.

Change-Id: I51cc9c19fd800f7991a46b80ee964a150820ec10

commit_message:
update refresh_cache on compute calls to get_instance_nw_info

addendum to commit 82599c77346bbefd550ea4ee6c0b13a3df4950af
allows calls to get_instance_nw_info to update the cache
without worry of infinite recursion

refresh_cache decorator ungracefully fails if instance
isn't somehow in the function args. This is so tests will fail
to prevent it from being incorrectly used.

Change-Id: If8c7c53db1c7d0d1f7c1d042b5a79bad5b7f45b6

why are we dropping Cells code?  It is still supposed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-21 20:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Vishy, See the discussion on the original patch: https://review.openstack.org/8428'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:12:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Please stop removing things that are seemingly not used, but which are the basis for future patches to land and/or may be used by add-on code or plugins.  Please at least have the decently to look for the original author of the code and the reviews/commits that introduced the code for comments and/or referenced blueprints.

You already removed all of the cells database calls and the 'cell_name' attribute in the Instance model which I've now had to add back in my topic branch.

Removing the actual table and cell_name column makes it impossible to maintain an external branch for people to use and experiment with cells."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

After discussing with Vish abandoning change.   But an inline comment around why unused code lives in the codebase would help prevent issues like this from arising again.'}]

subject: Added dictify() and uuids to the common request context.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Why can't the answer to the question 'what is a uuid?' be 'uuid.uuid4()'?

Seems like a situation of premature abstraction."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

And uuid.uuid4() is called in 28 places in nova right now as well. It's never been consistent and I've never understood why it's nova either.

More importantly, I don't want to continue doing the same thing just because "it's always been done that way".

I don't understand your comment about it being less intrusive leaving it in common. Leaving it out of common doesn't affect nova in any way. It can continue keeping it there without it being in common.

But I'll submit a patch to remove it soon anyway.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'd rather not import bad practices from nova if possible. Nova has the premature optimization problem really bad. My suggestion is to leave the gen_uuid in nova utils until the patch to remove it is ready, but in the code that is in os-common, just use uuid.uuid4() directly."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

To quote myself: "Nova calls gen_uuid in very many places. Even though it's trivial, it seems good to have one, centralized answer to the question 'what is a uuid?'"'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm not imposing the abstraction, though... gen_uuid is called in > 50 places in nova.  I'm reluctant to start down the path of undoing that without understanding why it was done in the first place.

Moving gen_uuid into common seems less intrusive than abolishing it.  I wouldn't object to it being abolished further down the road, but I'm trying to make the nova -> common transition as soft as possible."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Oh!  If it's inconsistent in Nova already then I don't have a leg to stand on.  I'll resubmit shortly."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

That is:  since the goal of that bit in common is to duplicate the behavior in nova, I'd like the calls to have the same name.  Removing the function call from common makes it less obvious that the call is meant to be identical."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Although I wouldn't have created the abstraction (or would have named it differently), I agree with Andrew's arguments in favor of keeping it/moving it for now."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-21 21:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/105/ : SUCCESS'}]

commit_message:
Added dictify() and uuids to the common request context.

This makes the common context similar enough to the nova
context that we can use it for annotating logs like
we do in nova.

Change-Id: I622c76f2e3013e4ff5e8c228d197a55918672447

commit_message:
Added a new attribute - display_choices
to Column class, for substituting the
display value of the statuses provided
by Nova to some more meaningful ones
in the instance table.

Fixes bug 997374

commit_message:
Admin action to reset states.

Adds an Admin API action to reset the state of an instance.  This will
at least allow easy clean-up from bugs which corrupt the state of an
instance and inhibit the owner of the instance from deleting it.

Change-Id: Ia059cbd643e24e04dede06da330f444d03b07674

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-21 18:16:42.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

The recent RPC versioning support introduced some odd behavior if a non-
existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not
exist (as the code used to do, in the form of an AttributeError), it now
Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found, instead
of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Change-Id: I4f29434a05b33442bd07562f3b821d6cedac3f8d
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid erroneous "Unsupported RPC Version" message if method is missing

The recent RPC versioning support introduced some odd behavior if a non-
existent method is called. Instead of reporting that the method does not
exist (as the code used to do, in the form of an AttributeError), it now
Reports "Unsupported RPC Version". This is highly confusing, as the RPC
versions *do* match and is just a result of the logic used to check
every advertised RPC proxy for the method.

This patch notes if any of the RPC versions matched the requested one,
and if so, raises an AttributeError if the method is never found, instead
of UnsupportedRpcVersion.

Change-Id: I4f29434a05b33442bd07562f3b821d6cedac3f8d

commit_message:
Propose nova-novncproxy back into nove core.

  * Use https://github.com/kanaka/websockify instead of wsproxy
    (which ships with noVNC)
  * Fixes bug 1001098
  * Looks for noVNC html files in /usr/share/novnc by default
  * Fix comments, and call utils.default_cfgfile()
  * use "except Exception"

Change-Id: I73dfe26fde699bb79aa1145bb1ab33f3a148bf21

commit_message:
Make libvirt LoopingCalls actually wait()

 * Adds wait() to all the LoopingCall timers
 * Fixes loopingCalls in baremetal/proxy.py as well
 * Includes failing test to verify result from destroy
 * Fixes tests depending on improper behavior
 * Fixes bug 1015355

Change-Id: I9e1914c446170e49f0aab76c7745b55d12132425

commit_message:
Add instance_id in Usage API response.

Fixes bug 1003093.

Required to fix horizon bug 1003299.

Add the instance_id in the server usage
response. The value of the id is the UUID
of the instance.

Change-Id: I77e0f64db456b4c80a03fa922dd18146b94d1187

These changes fix the tests, although I'm not sure how useful the second test is now that shutdown_terminate isn't being supported:

 diff --git a/nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py b/nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py
index 46ebce4..04ecc9a 100644
--- a/nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py
+++ b/nova/tests/api/ec2/test_cloud.py
@@ -846,8 +846,6 @@ class CloudTestCase(test.TestCase):
 
         test_instance_state(inst_state.RUNNING_CODE, inst_state.RUNNING,
                             power_state.RUNNING, vm_states.ACTIVE)
-        test_instance_state(inst_state.TERMINATED_CODE, inst_state.SHUTOFF,
-                            power_state.NOSTATE, vm_states.SHUTOFF)
         test_instance_state(inst_state.STOPPED_CODE, inst_state.STOPPED,
                             power_state.NOSTATE, vm_states.SHUTOFF,
                             {'shutdown_terminate': False})
@@ -2304,7 +2302,7 @@ class CloudTestCase(test.TestCase):
             self.assertEqual(result, expected)
             self._restart_compute_service()
 
-        test_dia_iisb('terminate', image_id='ami-1')
+        test_dia_iisb('stop', image_id='ami-1')
 
         block_device_mapping = [{'device_name': '/dev/vdb',
                                  'virtual_name': 'ephemeral0'}]
@@ -2350,7 +2348,7 @@ class CloudTestCase(test.TestCase):
         self.stubs.UnsetAll()
         self.stubs.Set(fake._FakeImageService, 'show', fake_show)
 
-        test_dia_iisb('terminate', image_id='ami-3')
+        test_dia_iisb('stop', image_id='ami-3')

         test_dia_iisb('stop', image_id='ami-6')"}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-06-21 00:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-21 00:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Fix related tests.

[{'created': '2012-06-21 00:43:17.000000000', 'message': 'Tidy up exception handling in contrib api consoles

Removes redundant exception handling from VNC consoles extension api module.
Both NotAuthorized and Invalid subclasses are already handled at the wsgi
application layer. Also gives a better message, including the id, when an
instance is not found.

Change-Id: Iefa4deeb46e4a12d012e7abe3c73d7d9c18afeff
'}, {'created': '2012-06-21 09:39:47.000000000', 'message': 'Tidy up exception handling in contrib api consoles

Removes redundant exception handling from VNC consoles extension api module.
Both NotAuthorized and Invalid subclasses are already handled at the wsgi
application layer. Also gives a better message, including the id, when an
instance is not found. Includes tweaks suggested by Vish in review.

Change-Id: Iefa4deeb46e4a12d012e7abe3c73d7d9c18afeff
'}]
commit_message:
Tidy up exception handling in contrib api consoles

Removes redundant exception handling from VNC consoles extension api module.
Both NotAuthorized and Invalid subclasses are already handled at the wsgi
application layer. Also gives a better message, including the id, when an
instance is not found. Includes tweaks suggested by Vish in review.

Change-Id: Iefa4deeb46e4a12d012e7abe3c73d7d9c18afeff

commit_message:
Sync before snapshots.

The filesystem state for an image is not guaranteed, so do the
best we can to make it consistent.

Change-Id: Ie59a83bc8d16bd88f0640bface3643b191053663

commit_message:
Added a base class for unit tests.

This provides some basic cfg and subout infrastructure
for tests.  It's similar to the test base used in
other OpenStack projects, so having it here should make
migrating tests to common somewhat easier.

Change-Id: I90775bf99313e7dd16929059132ee058287b3585

[{'created': '2012-06-21 06:15:59.000000000', 'message': "blueprint atmos-storage-adapter

Initial commit of Atmos storage adapter. Includes code
for the storage adapter and unit test code

Code allows glance users to specify an EMC Atmos powered
object storage cloud as a repository for glance images.

The code will allow users to upload, download, and delete images.
It leverages Atmos' object space methods to store images in a flat file
system and add an image-id to listable meta-data on the object.

You must configure the glance-api.conf file with your atmos parameters
for the storage solution to work.

Note - This is the first time I have submitted any code, so please be nice ;)

	new file:   glance/store/esu.py
	new file:   glance/tests/unit/test_esu_store.py
	modified:   glance/tests/unit/test_store_location.py
	modified:   glance/tests/utils.py

Change-Id: I7d02958379c8a0a01ac67237337edc2100f14370
"}]
commit_message:
blueprint atmos-storage-adapter

Initial commit of Atmos storage adapter. Includes code
for the storage adapter and unit test code

Code allows glance users to specify an EMC Atmos powered
object storage cloud as a repository for glance images.

The code will allow users to upload, download, and delete images.
It leverages Atmos' object space methods to store images in a flat file
system and add an image-id to listable meta-data on the object.

You must configure the glance-api.conf file with your atmos parameters
for the storage solution to work.

Note - This is the first time I have submitted any code, so please be nice ;)

	new file:   glance/store/esu.py
	new file:   glance/tests/unit/test_esu_store.py
	modified:   glance/tests/unit/test_store_location.py
	modified:   glance/tests/utils.py

Change-Id: I7d02958379c8a0a01ac67237337edc2100f14370

subject: Added iptables_manager ( based on openstack/linux_net.py ) This module will be the base library to implement security groups and generic firewall. It is an independent iptables module, made to be easy to package if used by agents and also inside quantum

commit_message:
Added iptables_manager ( based on openstack/linux_net.py )
This module will be the base library to implement security
groups and generic firewall.
It is an independent iptables module, made to be easy to package
if used by agents and also inside quantum

Using quantum.agent.linux.utils
Added support to root_helper

Change-Id: Iaa29322477fc2e753b52dc4f01e7c4a561110638

commit_message:
Adjust support for upcoming rootwrap changes

Adjust the recently-added support for upcoming nova-rootwrap changes to
match the latest proposed implementation. We now have a rootwrap.conf
configuration files that must point to the directory where the filters
are actually defined.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8747/1 for the Nova change that
justifies this.

Change-Id: I20f2bff0f9e87cb11d58f083a326656c4a124bf1

commit_message:
Skip argparse when injecting requirements.

Python 2.7 doesn't need argparse. Although pip installs are fine installing
it, listing the requirement in install_requires causes havoc for distro
installs which do not explicitly install argparse for 2.7 as a package.

Fixes bug 1013953

Change-Id: I0275d02e15c8fd2e63b88213ac32f6dd18e2fd26

Joe: Any idea on what the root cause of the failure is here?

This branch appears to remove the entire test suite... which seems a bit heavy handed.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-20 20:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dan,

I am not sure what the root cause of the failure is.  I did not investigate the problem.  Instead I just identified the offending commit and reverted it. There is precedent for doing this (https://review.openstack.org/8168)

For now I am looking for the quickest way to get the unit tests running again on my machine.  Until this bug is fixed I cannot run the full set of unit tests.   

I am happy to abandon this patch if someone finds the root cause of the failure.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-20 20:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Joe: I just took a quick look. It looks like we need to implement a proper fake for the Xen volume driver.

The reason I say this is that when tests fail it looks like vm_utils.py is getting called:

MemoryError
Logged from file vm_utils.py, line 343

----

Who was the author of the origin test case. Perhaps they would be willing to submit a corrected version of this?

If not we can just revert it I suppose.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-20 20:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Original author: renukaapte

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8156/

Added them to reviewer list.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-20 22:28:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Joe: Agree we shouldn't hold up trunk testing because of this. I'm fine with removing it and then they can re-add a version with a proper fake.

If someone gets a fake in the meantime I guess we can abandon this."}, {'account_id': 2535, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am still looking at what is causing the memory leak, and am not able to understand it. At some point the test seems to be doing an MMAP of about 4GB. Also it only happens when I run the whole suite and not just the xensm test.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

renukaapte, do you object to reverting this patch until the memory leak is fixed?'}, {'account_id': 2535, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:12:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I do not object. Dan Prince seemed to suggest writing a proper fake, which I am willing to do. Not sure I completely understand what he means and why that causes the leak.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

fixed the bug: 
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8786/

which is merging as I type this'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:39:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe, if this is still necessary even with the other patch, let me know, i'll drop the -2"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Trey,  I am testing your patch as I write this.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-06-20 23:45:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Can't instantiate abstract class ListUser with abstract methods get_data'}, {'account_id': 1699, 'date': '2012-06-20 18:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It's possible these changes depend on a version of cliff that hasn't been officially released yet. Dean, how do you feel about calling this cliff release 1.0? Is the API stable?"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-06-20 19:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Refactor cliff.Command.run()

* All commands now perform their action in take_action().  Those producing
  output are derived from DisplayCommandBase.

Change-Id: Ic93ba9a2ad449d84242b6aa8624b41379c4fb79a

commit_message:
Add cinder support

* using the new functional pattern: cinder_XXX functions are in
  lib/cinder
* enable with 'c-api,c-sch,c-vol' in ENABLED_SERVICES, n-vol is still the default
* exercises/volumes.sh runs for cinder and n-vol
* move config to /etc/cinder
* change volume_group to stack-volumes; this also renames the backing file
  to /opt/stack/data/stack-volumes-backing-file.
* removes osapi_volume from nova.conf enabled_apis
* integrates cinder + keystone
* launches c-sch
* tweaks for multi node
* move enabled_apis substitution to init_cinder

18Jun2010
* restored & rebased
* update setup.py to use setup_develop() in lib/cinder

Change-Id: I1e1aa4387031c56e4fa239eb73bea2af8cef0e38

commit_message:
Add two spaces of padding after OK.

The times column isn't justified properly. If we pad OK with two spaces,
then the left-most character in the time column will always be in line
because FAIL will always have 4 characters in it.

Change-Id: I9006fa70049c8010716e50ad6264ff0747151b65

[{'created': '2012-06-16 04:07:01.000000000', 'message': 'Modify reference to swauth in Swift post-install

fixes bug 791767
This fix removes a step in adding an additional proxy server that
was only necessary if using swauth, and was actually wrong in its
configuration.

For those using swauth instead of keystone, a shiny note at the
bottom directs to the excellent documentation for swauth on github

Change-Id: Ifd7b205a70b3455c92c76ffd8f1ad076710fecd6
'}]
commit_message:
Modify reference to swauth in Swift post-install

fixes bug 791767
This fix removes a step in adding an additional proxy server that
was only necessary if using swauth, and was actually wrong in its
configuration.

For those using swauth instead of keystone, a shiny note at the
bottom directs to the excellent documentation for swauth on github

Change-Id: Ifd7b205a70b3455c92c76ffd8f1ad076710fecd6

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,
I did a number of tests and have found some problems and issues. They are listed below. Please note that I am using version 1.1 of the Quantum service.
1. 
[f17-dev@localhost python-quantumclient]$ quantumv2 --os-quantum-api-version 1.1
Usage: quantumv2 [options]

quantumv2: error: no such option: --os-quantum-api-version
This only worked when export OS_QUANTUM_API_VERSION=1.1 was set
2. In some deployments keystone may not be implemented. In order to get this working I need to set the following:
export OS_TOKEN=ADMIN
export OS_URL=http://localhost:9696/
The documentation that you did was great. It would be great if this was part of quantum documentation.
3. When I invoke quantumv2 I am taken into the shell. Is this the correct functionality? From a user side it was a bit awkward.
4. By default it seemed that the verbose and debug flags are set.
[f17-dev@localhost python-quantumclient]$ quantumv2 
(quantumv2) list_nets default
send: 'GET /v1.1/tenants/default/networks.json? HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: localhost:9696\r\nAccept-Encoding: identity\r\nContent-Type: application/json\r\nX-Auth-Token: ADMIN\r\n\r\n'
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n'

Gary,
quantumv2 will enter into interactive mode if there is no command provided. This is a default behaviour from cliff.
but it has a bug when we provide options but not command.

I will upload a new patch to deal with this issue.

I am focusing on 2.0 now. I will clear up 1.1 codes later.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Great work.
I have done a number of tests.I am in favour of moving forward. Nonetheless we need to address the following:
1. I think that the client should do validating for all inputs (for example that an ip is a real and valid ip address)
2. In the case of creating subnets the client should set the ip version if this is not set by the user (i create a v6 subnet and the server returned that this is v4)
3. When entering the interactive mode it would be nice if there was a welcome message of sorts.
Hopefully these can be addressed or resolved in the future
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Doesn't seem to work

Comments for patch set 12 still hold :)'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Yong - I was able to use --tenant-id with 2.0 create_net using the SampleV2Plugin, so the issue was due to using a 1.1 plugin. Enabling the unknown options feature for 1.1 would be very helpful to my current work since the linuxbridge and openvswitch plugins don't currently support 2.0, but might not have much value otherwise. I might give it a shot in my own branch for my testing. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

I haven't gone over the code in detail yet, but have done some basic testing. So far, it looks pretty good! I tried using it with my provider networks extension branch in the server, and the client was able to display extension fields such as provider:vlan_id without any modification. 

I was hoping to be able to use your "unknow options" feature to pass extended parameters, but got the following error:

[rkukura@rkukura python-quantumclient]$ PYTHONPATH=`pwd` OS_QUANTUM_API_VERSION=1.1 OS_TOKEN=ADMIN python quantumclient/shell.py --os-username admin --os-password pwd --os-tenant-name admin --os-url http://localhost:9696/ -v create_net ten1 net4 --provider:vlan_id 123
usage: shell create_net [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--variable VARIABLE] [--prefix PREFIX] [--request-format {json,xml}] tenant-id net-name
shell create_net: error: unrecognized arguments: --provider:vlan_id 123
[rkukura@rkukura python-quantumclient]$ 

Is this feature intended to be available with the 2.0 API? If so, is there any reason not to enable it for the 1.1 API as well, which also supports extensions?

I also did a quick test of the 2.0 API for creating a network (with a 1.1 plugin), and got:

[rkukura@rkukura python-quantumclient]$ PYTHONPATH=`pwd` OS_QUANTUM_API_VERSION=2.0 OS_TOKEN=ADMIN python quantumclient/shell.py --os-username admin --os-password pwd --os-tenant-name admin --os-url http://localhost:9696/ -v create_net net6
DEBUG: quantumclient.quantum.v2_0.network.CreateNetwork get_data(Namespace(admin_state_down=True, columns=[], formatter='table', name='net6', prefix='', request_format='json', tenant_id=None, value_specs=[], variables=[]))
DEBUG: quantumclient.quantum.client we are using client: quantumclient.v2_0.client.Client
DEBUG: quantumclient.client REQ: curl -i http://localhost:9696/v2.0/networks.json -X POST -H "User-Agent: python-quantumclient" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: ADMIN"

DEBUG: quantumclient.client REQ BODY: {"network": {"name": "net6", "admin_state_up": true}}

DEBUG: quantumclient.client RESP:{'date': 'Wed, 20 Jun 2012 01:59:47 GMT', 'status': '400', 'content-length': '89', 'content-type': 'application/json; charset=UTF-8'}

DEBUG: quantumclient.client RESP BODY:{"QuantumError": "Running without keystyone AuthN requires  that tenant_id is specified"}

DEBUG: quantumclient.v2_0.client Error message: {"QuantumError": "Running without keystyone AuthN requires  that tenant_id is specified"}
ERROR: cliff.app Running without keystyone AuthN requires  that tenant_id is specified
DEBUG: __main__ clean_up CreateNetwork
DEBUG: __main__ got an error: Running without keystyone AuthN requires  that tenant_id is specified
[rkukura@rkukura python-quantumclient]$ 

I don't see a way to pass the tenant_id when not using AuthN. Is there a way to do this?

I'm not necessarily opposed to this being merged in its current state, so I'm not -1'ing it, but would like to at least see responses to these questions and look the code over more closely before approving it.

-Bob'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I've reviewed all the code now. Overall, I think its just about ready to merge. The two issues I found are:

1) The two empty __init__.py files added need Apache license headers.

2) I see "--tag" args in the comments in several files under quantumclient/quantum/v2_0, and also in the unit tests. Are these remnants of support for the metadata tags that had been in the V2.0 API branch for a while, but were then removed? If so, should they be removed from the client too to avoid confusion? Or are they something else?'}, {'account_id': 2350, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

Hi Gary,
for comments on 12, "I think that the client should do validating for all inputs": Validation should be moved to server, client just is responsible for data collecting, don't know what it is. Server should be do validation for all data passed by any kind of clients. Sometimes, it is quantum client, sometimes, it is from direct http post.
for interactive mode to show msg on entering, I think we can put it into later and make it a low hung fruit issue.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

hi Bob:
1. unknown options are just for API 2.0 commands
2. most command should have --tenant-id option to specify the tenant-id.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

API v2.0 features allow us to use unknown options, methods just select the information it needs, and don't complain abut other extra information provided by client. Also API1.1 will be soon deprecated, Are your extension will be backported into essex? If this is, we can add unknow features into client for v1x."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Doesn't seem to work

Thanks for the clarification and for fixing the __init__.py files.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-06-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: No score

commit_message:
add keystone support, new command interface, API v2.0

blueprint new-cli
Bug #1001053

Implement new commands interface, ready for v2.0. adopt cliff arch. new
client binary is quantumv2. After it is stable, we will remove quantum
binary. Httplibs2 is used.

usage: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1e_4UtnhFfgtnsB8EVB31BZKldaVzl_BlsGnGBrKmcDk/edit

Patch 2: add license header
Patch 3: add v1.0 support, fix show net details
Patch 4: quantumclient network api v2.0
Patch 5: subnet and port commands for api v2.0, add fields selector
Patch 6: add test cases
Patch 7: fix interactive mode, modify according to comments and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8366/, add two tasks to BP: noauth and openstack common
Patch 8: fix log problem
Patch 9: modify according to the comments by dan on patch 5
Patch 10: just trigger jenkins
Patch 11: pep 1.3 fix
Patch 12: cliff and prettytable to more than 0.6.0
Patch 13: change setup.py to include more packages
Patch 14: pep check on jenkins
Patch 15: add license text to empty __init__.py files
Patch 16: fix v1.1 test cases after server changes

Change-Id: Ibbbdd834371c6a023b31e4797718fc0fe9786d89

commit_message:
Remove some more glance-cache PasteDeploy remnants

The default_config_file arg to load_paste_app() was only used by the
cache daemons because they were all using glance-cache-paste.ini.

Since that use case is gone, remove the argument.

Change-Id: Ibf15810b37d9a2b9b94ed311c304916e7de2d6cf

commit_message:
Don't use PasteDeploy for scrubber and cache daemons

There are no WSGI apps involved here, no need to configure pipelines with
filters etc. All we're using PasteDeploy for is to construct an object.

Well ... there are easier ways to do that! :)

Change-Id: I4166d0071738fe587572db8f2883900408e9f097

commit_message:
Trace glance service on launch failure.

Where a glance service launched by a functional test fails to
begin listening on the expected port, attach strace(1) in order
to determine where the process is blocked.

Change-Id: Ic745bc34306c852fc8125a0a901686d4ff28e403

commit_message:
Capture logs of failing services in assertion msg

This is a temporary measure to help track down the cause of the
regular functional test failures that manifest as an unhelpful
'Unexpected server launch status' error.

(Previously the glancelogcapture plugin would have handled dumping
the logs, but this was broken by the recent change-over to nosetests
from run_tests.py)

Change-Id: I3dae58aa063536675503f23d1cc87767e68f75b2

Hmm, that py26 failure doesn't look valid to me."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-13 23:31:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would also like to point out that many future patches are to come - this is a relatively rough change :)'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-06-14 20:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-06-19 14:39:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

For some reason I always get really nervous when test cases and inheritance mix. I think I've run into some train wrecks with that before. But I can't see any specific problem, plus it seems like we already had some level of testing inheritance here.

One whitespace comment inline."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-19 16:45:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

While I do agree with you in general, I think this is one of the few use-cases for inheritance (maybe mix-in is the right term). I'm setting this up so we have a set of base tests that are coded to the pythonic DB API. I want to be able to plug in a new implementation and run the exact same tests as we already have for the sqlalchemy driver.

Anywho, I fixed the whitespace issue."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-19 16:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-06-19 16:54:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Convert db testing to use inheritance

This modifies the existing sqlalchmey-specific db tests to a more
generic approach where test cases can be inherited and bootstrapped
for different db implementations. It's a similar approach to our
store-specific bootstrapped test cases built off of test_api.

Related to bp refactor-db-layer

Change-Id: Ia516e93abd36e2727f122968d3c7ef6e0f1d5801

commit_message:
Add instance details to notifications

bug 1006120

Ceilometer needs to collect more data for determining the billing rate
for an instance. The most efficient way to get that data is to have it
included in the notifications sent by nova, rather than looking it up
after the notification is received.  This change adds details about the
location, size, and "type" of the instance to the existing notification
data. It also organizes the set of values into groups and adds comments
to clarify those groupings.

Change-Id: I01b7b550b0c4a5da1cc0dc764c9a6cb0161bf7e5

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-18 19:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nice work Thierry. Just one high-level comment before digging into this in detail ...

I don't think I buy that these files are "configuration". I think it's great to move them out of the python files, but ISTM that the only reason any user should want to change these rules is if they are also changing the code (or if the rules are broken wrt the code's actual behaviour)

As such, under the FHS, I'd actually put these in /usr/share rather than /etc

Another way to think about it is RPM has a %config directive which basically means that RPM should expect the user to modify these. If you mark it as %config(noreplace), RPM won't overwrite the contents on upgrade. I don't think it would make sense to mark these files as %config.

Summary - I think these should be in /usr/share/nova/rootwrap rather than /etc/nova/rootwrap.d'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-18 19:49:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've filed bug #1014812 - I don't think we should be loading all filters installed on the system."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-06-19 10:13:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Very good point on on /etc vs. /usr/share -- I admit I hesitated about where I should /encourage/ people to put those. The reason why I finally leaned towards /etc is that plug-ins are supposed to add their own filter definition files, and you don't really want them to mess with the package-owned /usr/share/nova. The other reason is that the same framework will be reused for pure configuration (specifying a log file or a search PATH for nova-rootwrap) so that part belongs to /etc.

I don't know much about Fedora, but under Debian, it's quite common that packages would put configuration snippets in .d directories -- and those snippets are not supposed to be modified by users: for their customization, users should add their own snippets. Unmodified config files will be upgraded, so that lets both system-oriented defaults and user-oriented configuration live happily together. The archetypal example of that is /etc/grub.d.

If everyone agrees with you, maybe I can change so that we only point to a /etc/nova/rootwrap.ini which, in turn, points to a list of directories containing filters, which would include /usr/share/nova/rootwrap (and plugins would just add their own filter directory to the list)."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-19 14:43:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

re: plugins, I don't see why plugins wouldn't install their rootwrap files into /usr/share/nova ... that should work fine

re: pure config like log file and search path, we shouldn't mix those up with the rootwrap rules. For example, when you update the nova package, you don't want your config touched but you always want your rules updated.

re: configuration snippets not supposed to be modified by users, they're not configuration :) That's just architecture independent data which belongs in /usr/share

re: /etc/grub.d, some packages are broken but that doesn't mean we should emulate them :)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-06-19 14:44:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oh, /etc/nova/rootwrap.ini solution sounds fine

(well, I'd prefer .conf over .ini but ...)"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-06-19 22:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think usability-wise it is preferrable if there is a directory where you just drop things rather than having to modify an ini/conf file. If you install multiple plugins, they will all want to clobber the conf file. As to where the directory should live, I will leave that to you guys to decipher. /usr/share/nova seems fine as long as plugins can install there.'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-06-20 07:02:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thierry: could we take the opportunity of this change to remove /bin/kill from KillFilters? It's kind of implied by the nature of the filter already ;-)

For the record, I agree with Mark about /usr/share vs /etc. But if we consider plugins that might get manually installed, then I understand the point about /etc. In which case the usual way is to support both (first load files from /usr/share, and then from /etc)"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-06-20 08:02:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

OK, looks like the distros need some extra flexibility here. So I propose that /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf lets you specify a filterpath that contains the directory(ies) on which to load filters. Distros can choose to have them in /etc/nova/rootwrap.d, in /usr/share/nova/rootwrap, or both. And distros can choose to deploy predefined filters wherever they prefer. If nobody complains, I'll start working on that today."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2012-06-20 15:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

New implementation @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8747/'}]

commit_message:
Move rootwrap filters definition to rootwrap.d

Move rootwrap filters definition from being defined within Nova
code to being defined in configuration files in a rootwrap.d
directory, to facilitate pluging-in new rootwrap commands.

Transition notes:
* nova-rootwrap now requires an additional (first) parameter pointing
  to the root-owned rootwrap.d directory, sudoers needs to be updated
  to specify that ("nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.d *")
* Packagers should ship rootwrap.d/{compute,network,volume}.ini rather
  than nova/rootwrap/{compute,network,volume}.py
* Filter definitions now only support strings. The KillFilter (which was
  using arrays as parameters) was modified and the tests updated.

This is step 2 for blueprint folsom-nova-rootwrap. It needs to go
in after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8524 so that devstack
supports the changes and the tests pass.

Change-Id: I584a2f5c7507a8ce3a76b8c0f192ca12b69f1e8f

commit_message:
Document underlying technologies

This is a first attempt to give the reader a sense of what the underlying
technologies are behind OpenStack Compute.

Shows two possible configurations, as well as a table with supported
technologies.

Comments welcome, especially if there are any inaccuracies or unclear
concepts. It was difficult to try to capture the interactions between
these technologies, especially on the networking side.

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/8465 with ZeroMQ reference
removed since ZeroMQ is not supported in Essex.

Change-Id: Ib66e9c5b7c27b214b2b363d78f872ff5357b1619

commit_message:
Explicitly set requirements in setup.py.

Reverts part of 5fb1e1f27f74a58318bf360d4535e4900ca2398f which
modified setup.py to parse pip-requires for requirements. This
fixes an issue where on Python 2.7 you would get a
pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: argparse error when trying
to run /bin/keystone commands.

Fixes LP Bug #1013953.

Change-Id: I3ed389eea694c9a7a50f270fa4b34abf7d32e34a

commit_message:
Fix import usage in AMQP for rpc.common

The existing line is technically OK, but it's not replaced by update.py on
file copy, therefore the import of common.rpc.amqp fails.

This fixes this problem by using a different syntax, the one that update.py
understand.

Change-Id: Id30f581477ab09c2b66fc0d65f1029554b311549
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

The paths for this configuration file are via the openstack common cfg. This configuration file currently contains the paste configuration. The plan is to move this to an external file.
In addition to this there is the actual plugin configuration file. The paths are according to the legacy quantum implementation.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-06-20 13:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

commit_message:
Implements the blueprint use-common-cfg for the quantum service.
More specifically uses global CONF for the quantum.conf file.

Added support for the RYU plugin (similar to ovs and lb,
which use non-global conf for plugins)

patch 27: clean up find_config_file
patch 28: for config file use old paths (plugin unit tests)
          this hopefully will be replaced when we move to common
          config file
patch 30: rebase and merge (utils.py and policy.py)

Change-Id: Ic0bf5bdd44f24a557240f7afe4e070dee448c63c

commit_message:
Add tox tests/pep8 for devstack-gate scripts.

Bug: 1010610

With this commit, we could run py26, py27 and pep8 tests
against these scripts, using tox.

* .gitignore
  Ignore build files.

* MANIFEST.in
  List of files to include in sdist package.

* setup.cfg
  Setup configuration.

* setup.py
  Script to generate sdist package.

* tools/pip-requires
  Pip dependency list.

* tools/test-requires
  Extensive list of dependencies to execute tests.

* tox.ini
  Tox targets.

Change-Id: I3f14af096b3078214d0747c2ab99b0a42b5190e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-19 14:47:05.000000000', 'message': "Adjust the libvirt config classes' API contract for parsing

Don't not automatically invoke the 'parse_dom' method from
the LibvirtConfigObject constructor, because this is too
early in construction - no child class constructors have
initialized yet.

Instead require the 'parse_dom' method to be invoked after
the bare object has been constructed. Also make the default
impl of 'parse_dom' take an etree.Element instance and
validate its root element name. Add a convenient 'parse_str'
method for turning a XML string into an etree.Element
instance & parsing it.

Change-Id: I7eda2b59869f3b4ef9dce1602cbb05f7662f4528
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust the libvirt config classes' API contract for parsing

Don't not automatically invoke the 'parse_dom' method from
the LibvirtConfigObject constructor, because this is too
early in construction - no child class constructors have
initialized yet.

Instead require the 'parse_dom' method to be invoked after
the bare object has been constructed. Also make the default
impl of 'parse_dom' take an etree.Element instance and
validate its root element name. Add a convenient 'parse_str'
method for turning a XML string into an etree.Element
instance & parsing it.

Change-Id: I7eda2b59869f3b4ef9dce1602cbb05f7662f4528
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

subject: Draft of concept for resource management.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-04 19:18:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-06-04 20:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I would prefer to see the test case class manage shared resources vs. the rest client(s). I demonstrated this in the base test case classes here:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7069/3/tempest/test.py

and

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7069/3/tempest/smoke.py

Having the test case classes manage the resources themselves allows different classes of tests (for instance, smoke tests that may not use the bare Tempest rest client) to destroy resources with the client they use internally.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-05 12:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jay, I think your proposal has a partially different goal. The reason for this proposal was that we saw so many cases of tests that forgot or mishandled the accurate freeing of all resources that were allocated. The intent here was to go from an alloc/free model to a "gc" model where you do not have to know exactly when a rest client call actually created resources, put try/catch around anything that might allocate, etc. Because the tempest rest client returns dictionaries, only the rest client knows how to free objects which is why I put the collector there. 

Daryl has suggested that we change the tempest rest client to return objects. If we did that and those objects had delete methods than your proposal could be ammended to auto-manage the resources as well, still keeping them in the Test class. But that would be a huge change compared to this proposal which is a minimal change to the test code. Unless these new objects subclassed dictionary perhaps. That said, it is unfortunate that we need both the tempest client and nova client when the code is almost entirely overlapping.

How do you think we should proceed?'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-06-05 16:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd like to weigh in a bit more in depth when I have a bit more time, but it's my belief that the test methods/test classes should be responsible for resource management. I understand that we have a problem with some tests not managing resources. I would say that going forward this should be a coding standard, and any submission that does not follow that criteria would be -1'ed until that's resolved."}, {'account_id': 4473, 'date': '2012-06-05 17:24:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

+1 what Daryl is saying. I'll take a closer look at the code at a later point but my two cents would be that the resource management is an awesome idea, however, I believe it should live at the test case level or above.

In general I do like the idea of global resource handling and I think that it is an important issue. From my point of view though, the clients should control talking to and receiving data from the AUT ONLY and not make logic assumptions, clean-up, etc... that the test case layer is better suited to handle."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-06-05 17:44:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't strongly disagree, but also think that the test writer should not have to make sure each resource is freed or to make some other call to track the resource every time an allocating rest client call is made. To avoid that there would need to be helper methods in the base test classes that wrap the rest client calls and track the resource along with the appropriate way to free it. This is not so hard and what Jay did in his last change to fix the network test."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-20 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-20 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-19 12:24:30.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid thread creation prior to service launch.

It appears that the thread serving out the fake HTTP endpoint used
in the copy-from tests is causing intermittent hangs in the launched
glance service processes. These hangs manifest as calls to futex(2)
that never return, and occur almost daily in Smokestack.

The background to the thread/fork mismatch is explained in this
blog post:

 http://rachelbythebay.com/w/2011/06/07/forked

We avoid the issue by delaying the thread creation until after the
service processes have been launched by the testcase.

Change-Id: I68c6f1735e5001641994ed4f84ad879397ba8713
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid thread creation prior to service launch.

It appears that the thread serving out the fake HTTP endpoint used
in the copy-from tests is causing intermittent hangs in the launched
glance service processes. These hangs manifest as calls to futex(2)
that never return, and occur almost daily in Smokestack.

The background to the thread/fork mismatch is explained in this
blog post:

 http://rachelbythebay.com/w/2011/06/07/forked

We avoid the issue by delaying the thread creation until after the
service processes have been launched by the testcase.

Change-Id: I68c6f1735e5001641994ed4f84ad879397ba8713

commit_message:
Ensure unique mac address allocation.
This is the first part of bug 1008029

If the port command does not contain a MAC address then Quantum will generate
a random MAC address. The mac address will be saved in the database to ensure
that it is not used by another port on the same network.

Added mock-based test for mac exhaustion.

Change-Id: I4d3fe12fd1e3c347b8e286d920a0609d0b3c4e8c

commit_message:
Pass serviceCatalog in auth_token middleware

 * This will allow  for chained requests (novaclient -> nova -> cinder)
 * Fixes bug 1010237

Change-Id: Iab126cb1f2fb01ca7da24fa9fe97ec81ee96e455

"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-14 01:06:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I definitely agree we shouldn't be automatically db_sync'ing on first startup. Are there any other integration points we need to be concerned with? I'm specifically worried about downstream consumers of this..."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-06-14 02:23:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The motivation behind this:

I'm seeing some potentially racey behavior between glance-api and glance-registry now that both of them use (and try to init) the DB. My use case is mostly dev/test oriented since I'm running both on the same machine but it could happen to an end user as well.

We could get fancy and use lockfiles or something to prevent both services from trying to init the schema at the same time but think it is much easier to just disable autocreation of the schema entirely and just call db_sync.

From an end user prospective troubleshooting the error message if the DB schema doesn't exist should be pretty straight forward:

FATAL:  database "glance" does not exist'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-06-14 20:43:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Dan:

I definitely buy this fix, I just want to make sure we don't cause a lot of churn downstream."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-14 21:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-06-14 21:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Removes Horizon's "time" module.

The module was an unnecessary hack for lazy test-writing.

Implements blueprint remove-horizon-time-module.

Change-Id: Ibeabd2b1689619a8e00c3346cef9401e5850d375

commit_message:
Fixed typo in routing conditions (bug 1006793)

The kwarg should be 'method' not 'methods', per Routes docs.
See: http://routes.readthedocs.org/en/latest/setting_up.html#conditions

Example in lieu of negative tests...
Without this change: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/18326/
With this change: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/18325/

Change-Id: If91fc0c79b320652674c68c433989a60c098dc1e

commit_message:
Speed up SQL unit tests.

Using a cached copy of the SQLite Data base speeds up the tests:

Before this change

Ran 44 tests in 126.154s
OK
Slowest 5 tests took 15.87 secs:
    3.34       test_delete_role (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    3.17       test_delete_user_with_tenant_association (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    3.17       test_create_tenant_invalid_name_fails (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    3.10       test_get_user (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    3.10       test_get_tenant_bad_tenant (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)

After this change:

Ran 44 tests in 58.996s

OK
Slowest 5 tests took 8.64 secs:
    2.57       test_add_user_to_tenant (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    1.58       test_update_tenant_long_name_fails (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    1.51       test_rename_duplicate_user_name_fails (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    1.50       test_delete_tenant_with_user_association (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)
    1.49       test_delete_user_with_tenant_association (test_backend_sql.SqlIdentity)

Slowest test was where the database was initialized

Change-Id: Idf046763e8718762695bbcedce4d223f654054db

commit_message:
General-host-aggregates part 1.  WIP

Partially implements blueprint general-host-aggregates: Xen decoupling

* keep rpcapi to compute-controller for Hypervisor-Pools
* Remove aggregate states
* Remove One aggregate per host restriction
* NOTE: Support for XenPools needs to be fixed

Change-Id: Idb12cc01362d0cc17ef5c93964d10b3ce18e8e36

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-18 09:28:11.000000000', 'message': 'check disk failure before syncing for each partition

If disk failure happens while object replication is ongoing,
object-replicator could replicate objects from other nodes to the root
file system.  It is because object-replicator does no mount check
(error check) at all after collect_jobs() is called, and it executes
rsync based on the old partition information in update().

This change prevents many objects from being written to the root file
system wrongly and fixes bug 1014545.

Change-Id: Icf740a2683e360df89eccb71b269977f294340b9
'}]
commit_message:
check disk failure before syncing for each partition

If disk failure happens while object replication is ongoing,
object-replicator could replicate objects from other nodes to the root
file system.  It is because object-replicator does no mount check
(error check) at all after collect_jobs() is called, and it executes
rsync based on the old partition information in update().

This change prevents many objects from being written to the root file
system wrongly and fixes bug 1014545.

Change-Id: Icf740a2683e360df89eccb71b269977f294340b9

commit_message:
Made dispersion report work with any replica count other than 3.

This changes the JSON output keys missing_one and missing_two to
missing_1 and missing_2 (if there are at least 2 replicas), drops
the missing_all key, and can add more missing_x keys depending on
the replica count. We will definitely need to post a prominent
notice of this change with the next release.

bug 862816

Change-Id: Ib747d944476638c33ee1d876b8f9db28953826e2

commit_message:
Move libvirt version comparison code into separate function helper

To help various areas of libvirt driver code to perform version
comparisons, move the libvirt version comparison code out of the
"init_host" method and into a seperate "has_min_version" helper
method

Change-Id: Idc54dceff7bda60e1459ebe7c9c60c869d15aedb
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
