[{'created': '2012-06-14 20:41:22.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure dnsmasq accept rules are preset at startup.

Fix bug 1000853.

This bug reported that after restarting nova-network, the dnsmasq ACCEPT
iptables rules were no longer present, causing instances to lose their
IP addresses.  This patch updates the restart_dhcp() function in the
linux_net driver to ensure these rules are present even if dnsmasq was
already running.  Before this was only done when first starting dnsmasq.

(cherry picked from commit aa1e71d1b313f80f5581b1422e3f3e5719569e50)

Change-Id: Icda3364d3a61018b912cea7a4c96b2cbcc1fbdd7
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure dnsmasq accept rules are preset at startup.

Fix bug 1000853.

This bug reported that after restarting nova-network, the dnsmasq ACCEPT
iptables rules were no longer present, causing instances to lose their
IP addresses.  This patch updates the restart_dhcp() function in the
linux_net driver to ensure these rules are present even if dnsmasq was
already running.  Before this was only done when first starting dnsmasq.

(cherry picked from commit aa1e71d1b313f80f5581b1422e3f3e5719569e50)

Change-Id: Icda3364d3a61018b912cea7a4c96b2cbcc1fbdd7

subject: bug #999953 xenapi driver intermittently fail to detach vbd
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 209, 'name': 'Josh Kearney', 'email': 'josh@jk0.org', 'username': 'jk0'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-17 20:43:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looks related to I3370c560a1997459ab37b9d5f1181464fa5b0f0c and bug #999953

What's the rationale for not cherry-picking the fix from master? Is it that the fix on master is more risky than necessary to just fix the bug for essex? If so, that probably makes sense"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-17 20:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Would something like the inline comments be a more faithful simplification of the folsom fix?'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-05-17 21:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Mark,

thanks for the review.

When I looked at the folsom fix, I figured I'd go with a simplified version of it (i.e. less changed lines to digest). I guess there are multiple ways of dealing with bug, and your proposal is also valid. 

The important thing is that this gets solved for essex/stable...how it's less important :)"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-05-17 21:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-05-24 07:59:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The more I look at this, the more I think it's safer to backport the fix from master

To get the behavior you want from vbd_unplug_with_retry() you need to make sure unplug_vbd() raises XenAPI.Failure exceptions for the REJECTED and DETACHED cases

However, for detach_volume() we need unplug_vbd() to return StorageError. So, the best thing to do is move the retrying into unplug_vbd() and have unplug_vbd() only raise StorageError. This is what the fix on master did"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2012-05-24 15:24:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

k, Mark I'll cherry pick the upstream bug fix.

bug #999953 xenapi driver intermittently fail to detach vbd

ensure that unplug_vbd raises XenAPI.Failure as required by
vbd_unplug_with_retry(session, vbd_ref).

Change-Id: If689da4ebc5d9042f26c765afb02ae611967a66b

commit_message:
Updates the cache

fixes bug 939122

Following are the changes done:
1. in compute/api.py to display the
   floating ip in nova list command upon
   its association with an instance.
2. in network/api.py to solve the similar
   issue upon the floating ip disassocaition
Updated version of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7059

Change-Id: Ief1a3f544c3d14bd61cc0814612df3ee521ddec2
(cherry picked from commit 7097e01a15ecd5c28b6b771e5043f18da243607e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-06-14 14:00:20.000000000', 'message': "Allow snapshot'ing of running instance via EC2 API

Fixes bug lp 988335

Previously the codepath was completely broken, using the wrong form of image ID,
relying on an unsupported image property, and attempting to download a non-existent
AMI manifest from S3.

It's now rationalized to simply delegate to the ComputeAPI to snapshot the instance.

Proposed to master as:

  https://review.openstack.org/8532

Change-Id: Ic33cf295b0324dcde045b22d42d99c521289da2d
"}, {'created': '2012-06-14 14:18:17.000000000', 'message': "Allow snapshot'ing of running instance via EC2 API

Fixes bug lp 988335

Previously the codepath was completely broken, using the wrong form of image ID,
relying on an unsupported image property, and attempting to download a non-existent
AMI manifest from S3.

It's now rationalized to simply delegate to the ComputeAPI to snapshot the instance.

Proposed to master as:

  https://review.openstack.org/8532

Change-Id: Ic33cf295b0324dcde045b22d42d99c521289da2d
"}]
commit_message:
Allow snapshot'ing of running instance via EC2 API

Fixes bug lp 988335

Previously the codepath was completely broken, using the wrong form of image ID,
relying on an unsupported image property, and attempting to download a non-existent
AMI manifest from S3.

It's now rationalized to simply delegate to the ComputeAPI to snapshot the instance.

Proposed to master as:

  https://review.openstack.org/8532

Change-Id: Ic33cf295b0324dcde045b22d42d99c521289da2d

Sucks that this back-end doesn't have any unit-tests"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-05-29 16:38:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like where you're going with the code, but not having any back-end/unit tests against this to verify correctness is going to bite us in the butt. Totally game for updating this, but please add a unit test to verify the functionality you're aiming to add around this. 

Mock away at pam or fake it up, but just patching on with no net here is going to bite us hard."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-06-01 04:29:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

He's actually not adding any functionality.  There's an unused method (get_metadata) that has the same exact logic that's in authenticate().  He's just removing the duplicated code and making use of the current unused method like it looks like was intended."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-06-07 17:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Adding self.get_metadata() in pam backend

The pam backend's authenticate() method is missing a get_metadata()
call.  This commit adds that and removes a small amount of duplicated
code.

Change-Id: Id175a2baa3c50d44081d8d46f60d960bfe98cb1f

commit_message:
Cisco cli cannot find argument action_prefix

Bug #1012502

Removed use of argument action_prefix for Client. Also, made HOST, PORT and USE_SSL global.
Signed-off-by: Harsh Prasad <prasad.tanay@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I93037b34fca89786778a2dcd8a3afc80df5687f8

commit_message:
Add missing ack to impl_qpid.

Fix bug 1012374.

Johannes Erdfelt pointed out that impl_qpid wasn't acking messages that
it received.  This turned out to be a nasty oversight, resulting in
unbounded message queue growth inside of the python-qpid library.  This
fixes it.

Change-Id: I0370293807f0282e1dbdd59246f70be031e888a9

commit_message:
Updates the cache

fixes bug 939122

Following are the changes done:
1. in compute/api.py to display the
   floating ip in nova list command upon
   its association with an instance.
2. in network/api.py to solve the similar
   issue upon the floating ip disassocaition
Updated version of: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/7059

Change-Id: Ief1a3f544c3d14bd61cc0814612df3ee521ddec2

[{'created': '2012-06-14 21:45:29.000000000', 'message': "Add autodoc generation to the build_sphinx command

The logic is pulled from the nova code, but has been abstracted
from being nova specific. It allows us to duplicate less info,
because we know a lot of the meta information in setup.py anyway.

Once this is in, we'll get autodoc module information everywhere
pretty much for free, and we can delete the doc/ext dir and the
doc/*sh from nova. (thanks to bcwaldon for pushing things to be
better)

Change-Id: I4c55c370ea6c3790958b5412e21e3378f4474104
"}]
commit_message:
Add autodoc generation to the build_sphinx command

The logic is pulled from the nova code, but has been abstracted
from being nova specific. It allows us to duplicate less info,
because we know a lot of the meta information in setup.py anyway.

Once this is in, we'll get autodoc module information everywhere
pretty much for free, and we can delete the doc/ext dir and the
doc/*sh from nova. (thanks to bcwaldon for pushing things to be
better)

Change-Id: I4c55c370ea6c3790958b5412e21e3378f4474104

commit_message:
Move docs to doc.

To better facilitate the building and publishing of sphinx
documentation by Jenkins we are moving all openstack projects with
sphinx documentation to a common doc tree structure. Documentation
goes in project/doc/source and build results go in project/doc/build.

Change-Id: I868df12e3c15cc30043e782ce0a609b9574295cd

commit_message:
Set default image for exercises

The exercises search for an 'ami' image to run; when multiple images are
loaded this fails.  Rather than try to guess or just use the first one
we set the default image name to the cirros image that we load by default.

Change-Id: Iae91a011ca9c42a7715747a68e0deba0dba20835

[{'created': '2012-05-26 17:04:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues when working through an outbound proxy

* openstackclient had unrecorded dependencies
* move setup.py invocation to a function to set proxy variables
* use keystone to get admin token (eliminate a direct curl invocation)
* check for cached image files of 0 bytes and re-download if needed

commit_message:
Fix issues when working through an outbound proxy

* reqork setup-develop() to handle proxy operations and empty dependency lists
* use keystone to get admin token (eliminate a direct curl invocation)
* check for cached image files of 0 bytes and re-download if needed

Change-Id: Ief356667ed3ef8d05c6604f12513ae81f68cec04

commit_message:
Fixing Nameless Volume Display

When a volume has no name, it now shows the
ID instead. I also added a fixture data that
represents such a volume being in the system.

Fixes bug #1012380

You can also now use truncate=i on DataTable
Columns in order to have the value truncated if
it goes beyond i characters.

On top of this I fixed/made-clearer a bunch of
the tests relating to volumes and instances.
Please do NOT use deepcopy() of fixture data
in tests any more, instead just create a new
fixture for the data you want.

Change-Id: If2f92b5d04b04f08f5cacca03f614fce5ea38702
